DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CSÓK, Z.;CSÓK, ZSOLT;CSO'K, ZSOLT;CSOK, ZSOLT;CSOK, Z.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Dr. Zsolt Csók obteve seu mestrado e seu doutorado em Química Orgânica na Universidade de Veszprém (atualmente, Pannon University, Hungria). Realizou pós-doutorado em várias instituições de pesquisa/universidades europeias (Università degli Studi di Salerno, Universidade da Madeira, École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne) por seis anos. Sua atividade de pesquisa envolveu o design e síntese de novos ligantes, a caracterização de complexos de metais de transição, e também, a investigação de relações entre estrutura e propriedade em aplicações catalíticas homogêneas. Na Universidade de Pécs (Hungria), atuou como pesquisador sênior por quatro anos. Em 2014, mudou-se para a Universidade de São Paulo no âmbito do programa "Ciência sem Fronteiras". Sua atual linha de pesquisa envolve a química supramolecular e a exploração de suas várias interações com a catálise.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Dr. Zsolt Csók has received his Master and his PhD degrees in Organic Chemistry at the University of Veszprém (now Pannon University, Hungary). He has spent six years as postdoctoral research fellow at various research institutions/universities throughout Europe (Università degli Studi di Salerno, Universidade da Madeira, École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne). His research activity involved novel ligand design and synthesis, characterization of transition metal complexes, and the investigation of structure/property relationships in homogeneous catalytic applications. At the University of Pécs, he worked as a senior research fellow for four years. In 2014, he moved to the Universidade de São Paulo in the framework of the 'Science without Border' program. His current research interests lie in the field of supramolecular chemistry and in exploring its various interactions with catalysis.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Functionalization of Cavitands Based on Resorcin[4]arene
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Functionalization of Cavitands Based on Resorcin[4]arene

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) Copper-catalyzed cycloaddition of steroidal azides and ferrocenyl-alkynes were found to be an efficient methodology for the synthesis of ferrocene-labeled steroids. At the same time, a great difference between the reactivity of 2-beta- or 16-beta-azido-androstanes and a sterically hindered 6-beta-azido steroid toward both ferrocenyl-alkynes and simple alkynes, such as phenylacetylene, 1-octyne, propargyl acetate and methyl propiolate, was observed. 2) Carbonylative Sonogashira-coupling and copper-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition were used effectively in the synthesis of ferrocene-labelled steroids. Steroidal alkynyl ketones were obtained in moderate yields from 17-ethynyl steroids without the necessity for the protection of the 17-OH group of various compounds. 17-triazolyl steroids with ferrocene labels were synthesized in excellent yields starting from the same substrates by a copper-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition. The new compounds were characterized by 1H and 13C NMR, MS and IR. 3) Carboxamido-steroids were synthesized via a palladium-catalyzed aminocarbonylation reaction of the corresponding iodoalkenes. The starting material was an unnatural steroid obtained by Wagner-Meerwein rearrangement. The 13-alfa-16-keto steroid was converted to a mixture of 16-iodo-16-ene and 16-iodo-15-ene derivatives in two steps by the Barton methodology. Aminocarbonylation of the steroidal alkenyl iodides was carried out using different primary and secondary amines as nucleophiles. The products, 16-carboxamido-16-ene and 16-carboxamido-15-ene derivatives, were obtained in good yields and were characterized by 1H and 13C NMR, IR and MS

Synthesis of ferrocene-labelled steroid derivatives via homogeneous catalytic methods
Synthesis of ferrocene-labeled steroids via copper-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition. Reactivity difference between 2β-, 6β- and 16β-azido-androstanes
Synthesis of steroid-ferrocene conjugates of steroidal 17-carboxamides via a palladium-catalyzed aminocarbonylation - Copper-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition reaction sequence
Synthesis of ferrocenylalkynyl ketones and their ring closure reactions
PRODUCAO-CT-DO-PROJETO.TIPO-PRODUCAO-CT: Participação em banca de trabalhos de conclusão(Mestrado)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) The interaction of phenol guest molecules with  2-methylresorcinarene and its methylene-bridged cavitand derivative has been investigated in methanol. The host molecules  were selected according to the flexibility of their cavities by  varying the conformational freedom of the molecular skeleton  prior to molecular association. The results have shown stronger  host-phenol interactions when the host molecule possessed a  rigid molecular skeleton (i.e., cavitand) compared to that of the  flexible resorcinarene with phenol. Although the enthalpy change associated with the molecular interactions was found to be the same in both cases, higher negative entropy change was obtained when the resorcinarene interacted with the phenol molecules at room temperature. As a result, stronger host-guest complexes were formed at room temperature when the host molecules, possessing a rigid molecular skeleton, participated in the complex formation. Furthermore, since the higher entropy change resulted in higher temperature-dependence of the interactions, the stability of the complexes formed with the flexible resorcinarene was smaller at higher temperature. These results highlighted that the decreasing flexibility of the host molecular skeleton itself can determine the entropy change during the complexation process; therefore, the temperature dependence of the complex stabilities highly depended on the flexibility of the host molecular skeleton. 2) 2-Methylresorcinarene and its methylene-bridged cavitand derivative as host compounds were investigated in selective complexation of alkali metal ions as guests in methanol media by photoluminescence measurements. These host molecules possess either flexible (2-methylresorcinarene) or rigid (cavitand) molecular skeleton. The Benesi-Hildebrand method and the vant Hoff theory have been applied to determine the stability constants and the thermodynamic parameters, respectively. Considerable interactions between 2-methylresorcinarene and Li+ or Na+ ions have been observed, while the rigid cavitand derivative can interact only with K+ or Cs+ ions. These results highlighted that the stability of the guest solvation shell and its size could play a key role in the selectivity behavior of host molecules. 3) A novel deepened cavitand featuring a significantly sizable portal has been synthesized and its interaction with some transition metal ions has been investigated in THF/H2O binary solvent using fluorescence quenching technique. The results suggested that among the used transition metal ions including Ag+, Cd2+, Cu2+, Fe3+, Cr3+, Hg2+, La3+, Mn2+, Ni2+, Zn2+ and Co2+, only Fe3+ and Cu2+ show good quenching ability. In order to interpret the quenching mechanism, the Stern-Volmer kinetics, and the presence of both the dynamic and static quenching have been discussed. It was found that the simultaneous presence of the sphere-of-action static quenching and dynamic quenching model agreed very well with the experimental results

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Functionalization of Cavitands Based on Resorcin[4]arene
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) A wide variety of 2-methyl-resorcinol-based deepened cavitands were synthesized from readily available reagents in a four-step procedure with overall yields of up to 62%. A systematic variation of the rim was carried out by building up a flexible upper aromatic wall on the rigid cavitand platform through CH2, CH2O and CH2OCH2 spacers. These aromatic walls were further extended by a Suzuki cross-coupling reaction. Full characterization of the synthesized cavitands was carried out. The solid-state structure of the tetrakis(phenoxymethyl)cavitand was determined by X-ray crystallography. Gas-phase theoretical calculations for this molecule predicted the presence of weak T-shaped interactions between the upper phenyl rings. The host-guest complex formation ability of two deepened cavitand hosts towards 4-chloro-benzotrifluoride was proved by photoluminescence method. 2) Palladium-catalyzed aminocarbonylation and cross-coupling reactions (Suzuki-, Sonogashira-, Stille-coupling) served as highly efficient synthetic tools for the synthesis of novel, functionalized deepened cavitands. Unexpectedly high chemoselectivities towards tetrafunctionalized cavitands have been observed for all of these reactions even using coupling partners much below the stoichiometric amount. No significant formation of either the mono-, di- or trifunctionalized products was observed. 3) A very efficient modular reaction protocol was developed to attach various functionalities to a rigid cavitand scaffold. In this way, aryl, iodoaryl, benzyl, pyrrolidylmethyl groups, as well as a polyethyleneglycol chain were attached to the triazol-level of the cavitand. The palladium-catalyzed ethynylation of the iodoarene moieties, followed by the copper(I)-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition produced novel cavitands with significantly elongated binding pockets. The dimensions of these molecules are calculated to be at least 9 x 18 angstrom, which place them amongst the largest unimolecular hosts obtained by pure covalent synthesis. A cavitand-based click conjugate is used for selective complexation of Cu2+ and Fe3+, providing significant fluorescent quenching
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Functionalization of Cavitands Based on Resorcin[4]arene

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: New Polyolefin Materials via Metal Catalyzed Copolymerizations
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: New Polyolefin Materials via Metal Catalyzed Copolymerizations

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: New Polyolefin Materials via Metal Catalyzed Copolymerizations
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) Two new vanadyl(V) amidinates have been synthesized and characterized by single crystal X-ray diffraction and 1H NMR. The complexes are dimeric with Cl bridges and monodentate coordination of the amidinate ligand to pseudooctahedral vanadium. In the presence of organometallic compounds of aluminum, these vanadyl complexes promoted the polymerization of propene and 1,3- butadiene. 2) The polymerization of propene in the presence of CpTi(CH3)3 / B(C6F5)3, at low temperature, afforded prevailingly syndiotactic elastomeric polypropylene. In the presence of methylalumoxane (MAO) and under the same polymerization conditions, both CpTi(CH3)3 and CpTiCl3 afforded elastomeric polypropylene with a stereochemical structure ranging from prevailingly syndiotactic to prevailingly isotactic, depending on the concentration of MAO. 3) Copolymers of propylene with 13C-ethylene (99% isotopic purity) have been prepared in the presence of Cp*Ti(CH3)3 / B(C6F5)3 (I) or CpTi(CH3)3 / B(C6F5)3 (II). 13C NMR analysis confirmed previous findings that propylene polymerization in the presence of I was highly regioselective and somewhat isoselective, while catalyst II produced regioblock polypropylene. In the presence of II, polymerization was slightly syndioselective and the average size of the primary regioblocks seemed to be larger than that of the secondary ones. Moreover, secondary insertion seemed to be more syndioselective than the primary one
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: New Polyolefin Materials via Metal Catalyzed Copolymerizations

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Young Talent Fellowship in the framework of 'Science without Border' program

PESQUISA-E-DESENVOLVIMENTO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Química de São Carlos

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Química de São Carlos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) We designed, synthesized, and characterized a  new class of multichromophoric cavitands based on resorcin[4]arenes. The  novel compounds have exhibited high values of second-order nonlinear optical (NLO) properties, as evidenced by electric-field-induced second  harmonic generation (EFISHG) measurements. Theoretical calculations  indicated the presence of edge-to-face T-shaped interactions between the aromatic building blocks within these multichromophoric systems, which was  further supported by the detection of hypsochromic shifts in UV−vis and  upfield aromatic chemical shifts in 1H NMR. We proved for the first time that the gain in the quadratic hyperpolarizabilities of multichromophoric NLO macrocycles, originating from the near parallel orientations of the subchromophores, can be partially suppressed if the distance between the dipolar subunits falls into a specific range, where intramolecular cooperative and/or collective effects are operative. 2) Palladium-catalyzed aminocarbonylation reactions have been used to directly convert a tetraiodocavitand  intermediate into the corresponding carboxamides and 2-ketocarboxamides. When complex mixtures of the amine  reactants were employed in competition experiments using polar  solvents, such as DMF, no mixed products possessing structurally different amide fragments were detected either by 1H or 13C NMR. Only highly symmetrical cavitands were sorted out of a large number of potentially feasible products, which represented a rare example of intramolecular, narcissistic self-sorting. Our experimental results along with thermodynamic energy analysis suggested that the observed self-sorting was a symmetry-driven, kinetically controlled process

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Synthesis and Structural Characterization of a New Metallodendrimer Family Using Ruthenium, Platinum and Palladium Complexes as Building Blocks
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Synthesis and Structural Characterization of a New Metallodendrimer Family Using Ruthenium, Platinum and Palladium Complexes as Building Blocks

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Synthesis and Structural Characterization of a New Metallodendrimer Family Using Ruthenium, Platinum and Palladium Complexes as Building Blocks
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The synthesis and full characterization of novel ruthenium complexes based on 1,3-dicyanobenzene were described. Crystal structures were reported for both [1,3-(cis-RuCl(P(CH3)3)4NC)2C6H4][PF6]2 and [1,3-(trans-RuCl(dppe)2NC)2C6H4][H2PO4]2. Ligand substitution in the homobimetallic complex lead easily to the monometallic analogue, [1,3-(trans-RuCl(dppe)2NC)-C6H4(CN)][PF6]. A heterobimetallic complex, [1,3-(trans-RuCl(dppe)2NC)C6H4(CN?FeCp(dppe))][PF6]2, of satisfactory purity, was also obtained
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Synthesis and Structural Characterization of a New Metallodendrimer Family Using Ruthenium, Platinum and Palladium Complexes as Building Blocks

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Nickel Complexes of New Pincer Ligands for Selective Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Nickel Complexes of New Pincer Ligands for Selective Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nickel Complexes of New Pincer Ligands for Selective Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The synthesis, properties, and reactivity of nickel(II) complexes of a newly developed pincer amidobis-(amine) ligand (NN2) were described. Neutral or cationic complexes were prepared by salt metathesis or chloride abstraction from the previously reported [(NN2)NiCl]. The Lewis acidity of the {(NN2)Ni} fragment was measured by the 1H NMR chemical shift of the coordinated CH3CN molecule. Electrochemical measurements indicated that the electron-donating properties of NN2 were similar to those of the analogous amidobis(phosphine) ligands. The solid-state structures of three complexes were determined. Reactions with alkyl mono-halides, dichlorides, and trichlorides were investigated. Based on these reactions, efficient Kumada-Corriu-Tamao couplings of unactivated alkyl halides and alkyl Grignard reagents were developed. Good yields were obtained for the couplings of primary and secondary iodides and bromides. Double C-C coupling of CH2Cl2 with alkyl Grignard reagents was also realized. Evidence was found for a radical pathway in Ni-catalyzed C-C cross-coupling reactions, which involves Ni(II) alkyl intermediates
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Nickel Complexes of New Pincer Ligands for Selective Carbon-Carbon Bond Formation

SERVICO-TECNICO-ESPECIALIZADO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Silicate and Material Engineering

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Silicate and Material Engineering

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Coordination Chemistry and Hydroformylation Activity of Platinum Complexes Containing 1-Aryl-Phospholes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The reactions of the sterically crowded 1-aryl-phospholes with PtCl2(PhCN)2 were investigated by NMR spectroscopy. Significant differences in their reactivity towards PtCl2(PhCN)2 have been observed. Both cis-PtCl2(phosphole)(PhCN) and trans-PtCl2(phosphole)2 complexes were formed under normal reaction conditions. The reduced aromatic character of the coordinated phosphole ligands has been confirmed by the pyramidalization of the phosphorus and the loss of the perpendicular arrangement of the phosphole and aryl rings. While the reaction of the sterically congested phospholes with [Rh(nbd)Cl]2 resulted in the formation of Rh(nbd)(phosphole)Cl complexes, the most basic phosphole brought about the [Rh(nbd)(phosphole)2]+ cation. Both the conversion and the regioselectivity of platinum- and rhodium-catalyzed hydroformylation of styrene have shown strong dependence on the basicity of the phosphole ligand
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Coordination chemistry and hydroformylation activity of platinum complexes containing 1-aryl-phospholes

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CSÓK, Z.;CSÓK, ZSOLT;CSO'K, ZSOLT;CSOK, ZSOLT;CSOK, Z.

PRODUCAO-CT-DO-PROJETO.TITULO-DA-PRODUCAO-CT: Platinum Complexes of Phospholes with Reduced Pyramidal Character
Coordination chemistry and hydroformylation activity of platinum complexes containing 1-aryl-phospholes
Platinum Complexes of Phospholes with Reduced Pyramidal Character from Steric Crowding
Platinum complexes of phospholes with reduced pyramidal character from steric crowding

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: New Phosphorous-Containing Ligands in Homogeneous Catalytic Carbonylation Reactions
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: 1) The synthesis and full characterization of eight new calix[n]arene sulfonate esters, including their conformational analysis were carried out. While p-tBu-calix[6]arene and p-tBu-calix[8]arene esters were conformationally labile in the temperature interval of 25-100°C, p-tBu-calix[4]arene mono- and diesters were isolated as stable conformers at ambient temperature. Two 1,3-functionalised compounds of these derivatives were shown unexpectedly high conformational stability up to 100°C by dynamic NMR measurements. The NMR measurements confirmed the pinched-cone conformation for both derivatives. For the dealkylated calixarene derivatives, the partial cone conformer of the triesters have been obtained as major products in all cases. 2) Calix[4]arene-based tetraphosphinite and tetraphosphine ligands, as well as their platinum, palladium and rhodium complexes were synthesized, characterized and tested as catalysts in carbonylation reactions. High chemoselectivity was obtained in hydroformylation in the presence of rhodium-containing catalysts both with the above calixarene-based phosphine and phosphinite ligands. The regioselectivity towards branched aldehyde has shown a strong temperature dependence in case of the phosphinite derivative
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: New Phosphorous-Containing Ligands in Homogeneous Catalytic Carbonylation Reactions
